intro: Molina dependens, commonly known as the silverleaf molina, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its silver-gray foliage, which helps it reflect sunlight and reduce water loss. It produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple. Molina dependens is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
